import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
%matplotlib inline
source.eec4fa84:
labels = data['type'].value_counts().keys()
size = data['type'].value_counts().values
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize =(10, 7))
ax.pie(size,labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%')
ax.axis('equal')
plt.show()

source.ff2de52a:
Netflix, Inc. is an American over-the-top (OTT) content platform and production company headquartered in Los Gatos, California, United States. The company is a subscription-based streaming service provider offering online streaming from a library of films and television series, 40% of which is Netflix original programming produced in-house.
This is an exploratory data analysis of the Netflix Content for the past years.
source.7edcb4da: ### On analyzing the data, we can say that the Movies in Netflix has a major audience of Adults and Teens
source.83815a11: ## Handling Missing Values in director, cast, country, rating, date_added
source.4c93353f: ### The content published is shown to be increase gradually and have a peak at 2019 and decrease after that.
source.d06e044b:
Data Features:

  • Show ID: An unique identifier for each show
  • Type: Specifies the type of the content - Movie, TV Show
  • Title: Title of the content
  • Director: Name of the content's director
  • Cast: List of People who are part of the content's star cast
  • Country: The country base of the content
  • Date Added: Date on which the specific content was added on Netflix
  • Release Year:Date on which the specific content was released
  • Rating: Rating of the content on Netflix
  • Duration: Total time duration of the show or movie
  • Listed In: The external listing categories the content falls under
  • Description: Description of the show
